intro: Silene brevistipes, commonly known as the short-stemmed catchfly, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, pinkish-purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as meadows and rocky slopes. It has small, lance-shaped leaves and a low-growing habit, often forming dense mats. Silene brevistipes is adapted to arid environments and is considered a rare and endangered species in many areas.
